en.%project_settings_scriptureForge_project: This project's ID according to Scripture Forge. It is generated upon connecting a project to Scripture Forge. This is distinct from the project's ID according to Paratext. Empty means the project is not connected to Scripture Forge.
en.%scriptureForge_draft_action_cannotAcces: Ask your administrator for access to Auto Drafts.
en.%scriptureForge_draft_action_cannotSetUp: Ask your administrator to connect this project to Scripture Forge.
en.%scriptureForge_draft_viewer_header_desc: This AI-generated pre-translation contains errors. [Open in Scripture Forge]({scriptureForgeProjectGenerateDraftUrl})
en.%scriptureForge_home_description_md%:
This extension allows you to use limited features of Scripture Forge:

- View the list of projects you can see in Scripture Forge
- Open drafts that have already been generated by AI for a project in Scripture Forge

{loginContent}

An administrator must connect a project in Scripture Forge and generate an AI draft
before you can interact with it in this extension.

Visit [Scripture Forge]({scriptureForgeUrl}) to access
its full set of features.
en.%scriptureForge_home_failed_login_check_: Scripture Forge failed to determine if you are logged in. {errorMessage}
en.%scriptureForge_home_failed_login_format: Scripture Forge failed to log in. {errorMessage}
en.%scriptureForge_home_failed_logout_forma: Scripture Forge failed to log out. {errorMessage}
en.%settings_scriptureForge_serverConfigura: Configuration determining which servers to use for Scripture Forge and authentication. You can use the presets `live`, `qa`, or `dev`, or you can specify your own configuration in JSON following the `ServerConfiguration` type in the `scripture-forge` extension.
Server configuration preset name must be one of {presetNames}
Custom configuration must follow the `ServerConfiguration` type in the `scripture-forge` extension
